yiddish.text: In the mirror everybody sees his best friend.
A table is not blessed if it has fed no scholars.
A thief's end is hanging.
A wise man hears one word and understands two.
A wise man knows what he says, a fool says what he knows.
A wounded soul is difficult to heal.
After nine months the secret comes out.
All dumb people have a lot to say.
All of us are crazy in one way or another.
All signs are misleading.
All things grow with time, except grief.
A fool will jump into the bath and forget to wash his face.
A friend you get for nothing; an enemy must be bought.
A golden key will open every lock.
A good cry lightens the heart.
A good friend is often better than a brother.
A good friend you get for nothing, an enemy you have to buy.
A good man, but his mad dog won't let you speak to him.
A good name is better than a precious stone.
A guest for a day is welcome the whole year.
A guest is like rain: when he lingers on, he becomes a nuisance.
Don't approach a goat from the front, a horse from the back or a fool from any side.
Don't ask questions about fairy tales.
Don't bargain with God.
Don't be scared when you have no other choice.
Don't be too sweet lest you be eaten up; don't be too bitter lest you be spewed out.
Don't call a man honest just because he never had the chance to steal.
Don't live in a town where there are no doctors.
Don't settle in a place where the doctor has gout.
Don't throw a stone into a well from which you have drunk.
Don't throw away the old bucket until you know whether the new one holds water.
Your pot broken seems better than my whole one.
He who stands by his point of view, must be ready to suffer hunger.
He who would have others pity him must pity others.
Health comes before making a livelihood.
Health? Very nice! But where will we get potatoes?
Heaven and hell can both be found on earth.
Hell is not so bad as the road that leads to it.
Hell itself can be no worse than the road that leads to it.
Hell shared with a sage is better than paradise with a fool.
Hire staff but do it yourself.
Hope for miracles, but don't rely on one.
Seek advice, but use your own common sense.
Seek and ye shall find.
Send a fool to close the shutters and he'll close them all over town.
Send a fool to the market and a fool he will return.
She who wants to marry her stepfather regrets it in bed.
Show a dog a finger, and he wants the whole hand.
Show her the rudder, but don't steer her boat.
Shrouds are made without pockets.
Silence is also speech.
If there's bitterness in the heart, sugar in the mouth won't make life sweeter.
If things are not as you wish, wish them as they are.
If triangles had a God, He'd have three sides.
If two people say he is drunk, the third one should sleep.
If we all pulled in one direction, the world would keel over.
If we cannot do what we want, we must want what we can.
If we cannot do what we will, we must will what we can.
If we did not flatter ourselves, nobody else could.
If you are bitter at heart, sugar in the mouth will not help you.
If you are lucky, even your ox will calve.
Walk straight and you will not fall.
We are all schlemiels.
We have far greater compassion for another's misfortune than our pleasure in another's good fortune.
Weeping makes the heart grow lighter.
What a fool can spoil, ten wise men cannot repair.
What a man thinks up for himself, his worst enemy couldn't wish for him.
What can you do with a good cow that gives a lot of milk and then kicks the bucket over?
What good is honor when you're starving?
What soap is for the body, tears are for the soul.
What soap is to the body, laughter is to the soul.
What use is wisdom when folly reigns?
What value is a needle without an eye?
What will be, will be.
What you don't see with your eyes, don't invent with your tongue.
What you save is, later, like something found.
What's left over from the thief is spent on the fortune-teller.
When a father gives to his son, they both laugh.
When a fool has the cow by the horns, the wise man can milk it.
When a miller fights with a chimney sweep, the miller gets black and the chimney sweep gets white.
When a mother calls her child bastard, you can take her word for it.
"For example" is not proof.
A bad peace is better than a good war.
A big crowd, but not a human being in sight.
A bird is known by his feathers.
A blow passes on, a spoken word lingers on.
A boil is fine as long as it's under someone else's arm.
A cat loves fish, but won't risk its claws.
A child's tear rends the heavens.
A chip off the old block.
A chip on the shoulder indicates wood higher up.
All women are heirs to Mother Eve.
An angry man is not fit to pray.
An animal's end is slaughter.
An empty barrel makes a lot of noise.
An imaginary ailment is worse than a disease.
An imaginary sickness is worse than a real one.
An unkept promise leads to a bad life.
Anger is like a thorn in the heart.
Anger is the thorn in the heart.
As the fat man gets thinner, the thin one is already dead.
A person should stay alive, if only out of curiosity.
A person should want to live, if only out of curiosity.
A person's worst enemy can't wish on him what he can think up himself.
A quarrel is like an itch; the more you scratch, the more it itches.
A quiet fool is half a sage.
A rich man has no need of character.
A rich man who is stingy is the worst pauper.
A rich man's foolish sayings pass for wise ones.
A rich mouthful, a heavy groan.
A snake deserves no pity.
A lion doesn't fear a fly.
A lock is meant only for honest men.
A man cannot jump over his own shadow.
A man cannot spin and reel at the same time.
A man comes from the dust and in the dust he will end--and in the meantime it is good to drink a sip of vodka.
A man is not honest simply because he never had a chance to steal.
A man is not old until his regrets take the place of his dreams.
A man should go on living -- if only to satisfy his curiosity.
A man should live if only to satisfy his curiosity.
A man should stay alive if only out of curiosity.
Better a thief for a neighbor than an overzealous rabbi.
Better an honest slap in the face than an insincere kiss.
Better an ounce of happiness than a pound of gold.
Better an ounce of luck than a pound of gold.
Better ask ten times than go astray once.
Better ruined ten times than dead once.
Better ten times ill than one time dead.
Better the best of the worst than the worst of the best.
Better to die upright than to live on your knees.
Better to hear curses than to be pitied.
A half truth is a whole lie.
A half-truth is a whole lie.
A heavy purse makes a light heart.
A hero is someone who can keep his mouth shut when he's right.
A jest is half a truth.
A joke driven too far brings home hate.
A lazy messenger is not short of excuses.
A lie can take you far away -- but with no hope of return.
Charity covers a multitude of sins.
Charity excuseth not cheating.
Charm is more than beauty.
Come for your inheritance and you may have to pay for the funeral.
Dear God: You do such wonderful things for complete strangers; why not for me?
Death does not knock on the door.
Do good and ask not for whom.
Do not show a stick to a dog that has been beaten.
Doctors and gravediggers are partners.
A man too good for the world is no good for his wife.
A man's worst enemies can't wish on him what he can think up himself.
A meowing cat catches no mice.
A nation's treasure is its scholars.
A penny is a lot of money, if you have not got a penny.
A penny is a lot of money--if you haven't got a penny.
A penny is sometimes better spent than spared.
A penny saved is a penny earned, but sometimes a penny is better spent than saved.
A person can study for seventy years and at the end die a fool.
A person should live if only for curiosity's sake.
Drive the horse with oats, not with curses and oaths.
Dying while young is a boon in old age.
Each child brings his own blessing into the world.
Eggs may be smarter than the chickens, but it doesn't take long for them to stink.
Either it doesn't help or it isn't needed.
Even a ball of wool has a beginning.
Even in heaven, it is not good to be alone.
Every answer can result in a new question.
Every man knows that he must die, but no one believes it.
Every poor man has a dry throat and wet boots.
Stubbornness is the greatest ill.
Stupid solutions that succeed are still stupid solutions.
Surrounding yourself with dwarfs does not make you a giant.
Talk too much and you talk about yourself.
Talking comes by nature, silence by wisdom.
Tasty is the fish on someone else's dish.
Ten enemies cannot do a man the harm that he does to himself.
The apple does not fall far from the tree.
The best horse needs a whip, intelligent men need advice, and devout women need a man.
The body is a sponge, the soul an abyss.
A clock that stands still is better than one that goes wrong.
A dead man is mourned seven days;a fool, his lifetime.
A deaf man heard how a mute told that a blind man has seen how a cripple walked.
A dog without teeth will also attack a bone.
A farmer should not ride the king's horse.
A flatterer must not lose his temper.
A fool is his own informer.
A fool says what he knows, and a wise man knows what he says.
A fool shows his annoyance at once, but a prudent man overlooks an insult.
A fool who can keep silent is counted among the wise.
As the sheep are shorn, the lambs shiver.
As we live, so we learn.
Ask about your neighbors, and then buy the house.
Ask advice from everyone, but act with your own mind.
Ask and you won't get lost.
Attractiveness is better than beauty.
Before you start up a ladder, count the rungs.
Being too nice can cost a lot.
Better a Jew without a beard than a beard without a Jew.
Better a slap from a wise man than a kiss from a fool.
Every pot will find its lid.
Every question has an answer.
Every seller praises his wares.
Every worm has its hole.
Everyone is kneaded out of the same dough, but not baked in the same oven.
Everything ends in weeping.
Experience costs blood.
Fear is worse than the ordeal itself.
Flattery makes friends and truth makes enemies.
Flattery sits in the parlour when plain dealing is kicked out of doors.
If rich people could hire other people to die for them, the poor could make a wonderful living.
If Saint Paul's day be fair and clear, it will betide a happy year.
If someone throws stones at you, throw back bread.
If the bride can't dance, she blames the musicians.
If the eyes didn't see, the hands wouldn't take.
If the father marries the aunt, he's an uncle.
If the pupil is smart, the teacher gets the credit.
If the rich could hire other people to die for them, the poor could make a wonderful living.
If the rich could hire someone else to die for them, the poor would make a wonderful living.
If there is bitterness in the heart, sugar in the mouth won't make life sweeter.
Money will buy you everything but good sense.
Mothers-in-law are fine so long as they are deaf and blind.
Necessity can break iron.
Never approach a goat from the front, a horse from behind, and a fool from both sides.
Never try to be more foolish than the jester.
No blessing is bestowed on a secret.
No choice is also a choice.
No choice is an option.
No man suffers from another's sins - he has enough of his own.
Not all nice things are dear, but those that are dear are nice.
Not everyone who sits in the seat of honor is master.
Not only that the rich man is rich, but he has such good checks too.
Nothing comes easy.
Nothing falls from heaven.
Nothing is too difficult you only need to know how.
Nothing tastes more bitter than the truth.
Once it was the parents who taught their children to talk; now the children teach their parents to keep quiet.
Once poor, never rich.
One ass calls the other a pack animal.
One rotten apple spoils the other.
One should not send a cat to deliver cream.
One who wants to know is better than one who already knows.
Other people's troubles are bearable.
Out of desperation, one finds.
Over the bottle many a friend is found.
Parents can give everything but common sense.
Parents can give their children everything except good luck.
Pearls around the neck, stones upon the heart.
The talk of the day is the dream of the night.
The truly rich are those who enjoy what they have.
The truth is not always what we want to hear.
The ugliest life is better than the nicest death.
The way you prepare the bed, so shall you sleep.
The wheel turns round.
The whole world is a dream, and death the interpreter.
The wise man, even when he holds his tongue, says more than the fool when he speaks.
The wolf is not afraid of the dog, but he doesn't like the sound of his barking.
There is nothing new under the sun -- and that's why there remains such a mess.
Golden dishes will never turn black.
Golden dreams make men wake hungry.
Good news always comes from far away.
Had you gotten up early, you wouldn't have needed to stay up late.
Half-truth -- whole lie.
Happy is she who conducts herself honorably.
He avenged himself on fleas, and burned up his bed.
He falsifies who renders a verse just as it looks.
He that can not endure the bad will not live to see the good.
He that can't endure the bad, will not live to see the good.
If I dealt in candles, the sun wouldn't set; if I dealt in shrouds, people would stop dying.
If I try to be like him, who will be like me?
If it goes, it goes, don't force it.
If it must always be better, it can never be good enough.
If it were God's will, you could shoot with a broom too.
If one has nothing to answer, it is best to shut up.
If one link has broken so has the whole chain.
If one soldier knew what the other thinks, there would be no war.
If only one race has to be chosen, why the Jews?
If praying had helped, he could have hired someone to do it.
Beware of still water, a still dog, and a still enemy.
Borrow causes sorrow.
By day they're ready to divorce, by night they're ready for bed.
Bygone troubles are a pleasure to talk about.
Bygone troubles are good to tell.
Ca' me, ca' thee.
Cancer--schmancer!--as long as you're healthy.
Candlemas day, put beans in the clay; put candles and candlesticks away.
Charge nothing and you'll get a lot of customers.
Charity and pride have different aims, yet both feed the poor.
God created people because he loves stories.
God gave burdens, also shoulders.
God is a father, happiness is a stepfather.
God is an honest payer, but a very slow one.
God loves the poor and helps the rich.
God made man because he loves stories.
God sends burdens... and shoulders.
God will provide -- ah, if only He would till He does.
God will provide. If only God would provide until He provides.
Gold's father is dirt, yet it regards itself as noble.
If all pulled in one direction, the world would keel over.
If charity cost nothing and benevolence caused no heartache, the world would be full of philanthropists.
If charity costs nothing, the world would be full of philanthropists.
If each one sweeps before his own door, the whole street is clean.
If everyone were allowed to take from the world all her heart desired, there would be nothing left for anyone else.
If Fortune calls, offer him a seat.
If God lived on Earth, all his windows would be broken.
If God wants people to suffer, he sends them too much understanding.
If God were living on earth, people would break His windows.
If I am like others, who will be like me?
If you stay at home you won't wear out your shoes.
If you tell the truth, you don't have to swear.
If you want people to think you are wise, agree with them.
If you want to give God a good laugh, tell Him your plans.
If you want to know what God thinks of money, look at the people he gives it to.
If you want your dreams to come true, don't over sleep.
If you're fated to drown, you may die in a teaspoon of water.
If you're out to beat a dog, you're sure to find a stick.
If you're skilled, your wallet will be filled.
If your friend becomes your enemy, he will be your enemy for life.
Hope may give a man strength, but not sense.
How many will listen to the truth when you tell them?
How you run your life, that's how your clock will run.
I can find good in my boss but he is at loggerheads with me.
I can't sing but I am a musicologist.
If a Jew cannot be a shoemaker, he will dream of being a professor.
If a link is broken, the entire chain breaks.
If a link is broken, the whole chain breaks.
If a man is destined to drown, he will drown even in a spoonful of water.
If a person is fated to drown, he'll lose his life even in a teaspoon of water.
Flattery will get you nowhere.
Fleas are not lobsters.
For example is not the same as proof.
Friends are needed both for joy and for sorrow.
From success to failure is one step; from failure to success is a long road.
From the black earth there grows the finest grain.
Give me, Lord, my daily bread, I will get my own brandy.
Go quickly but don't fall off my step.
God could not be everywhere and therefore He made mothers.
God created a world full of little worlds.
Love me a little but long.
Love tastes sweet, but only with bread.
Love your neighbor, even if he plays the trombone.
Lovers and thieves always look for darkness.
Lovers do not need much room.
Make new friends, but don't forget the old ones.
Make no more haste than good speed.
Make sure to send a lazy man for the Angel of Death.
Man makes plans, and God laughs.
Man strives, and god laughs.
He that cannot ask cannot live.
He that cannot obey cannot command.
He that cannot pay, let him pray.
He that lies on the ground cannot fall.
He who can't endure the bad will not live to see the good.
He who comes for the inheritance is often made to pay for the funeral.
He who has children will never die of starvation.
He who marries for money earns it.
He who puts up with insult invites injury.
He who runs away from the fire, falls in the water.
The luck of an ignoramus is this: He doesn't know that he doesn't know.
The nearer to the synagogue, the farther from God.
The pen wounds deeper than an arrow.
The rabbi drinks the wine and asks the others to be happy.
The rich man doesn't pay, the debtor does.
The rich man who is stingy is the worst pauper.
The schlemiel lands on his back and bruises his nose.
The scholar knows what she lacks knowledge of.
The soldiers fight, and the kings are heroes.
The sun shines brighter after a shower.
Perfection anywhere is very rare.
Praise the young and they will blossom.
Prayers go up and blessings come down.
Pride can live in the dungheap.
Protest long enough that you are right, and you will be wrong.
Provide for the worst; the best can take care of itself.
Quiet streams erode the shore.
Rejoice not at your enemy's fall, but don't pick him up, either.
Rich man down and poor man up -- they are still not even.
Rob not, repent not.
Who talks a lot, talks about himself.
Who wins first, loses last.
Whoever looks for easy work goes to bed very tired.
Whoever needs milk, bows to the animal.
With a child in the house, all corners all full.
With money in your pocket, you are wise and you are handsome and you sing well, too.
With time, even a bear can learn to dance.
Women can keep only one secret -- their own.
Words should be weighed and not counted.
Words show the wit of a man, but actions his meaning.
It's astonishing how important a man becomes when he dies.
It's easier to be a critic than an author.
It's good to hope, it's the waiting that spoils it.
It's never too late to die or get married.
It's not as good with money as it is bad without it.
It's not so terrible when you lose money. when courage is lost, all is lost.
Laugh and everyone sees it, cry and no one sees it.
Laughter can be heard further than weeping.
Lend everyone your ears, give a hand to your friends but give your lips only to a woman.
Lend money and acquire an enemy.
Life is just like a dream -- but don't wake me.
Life is the biggest bargain -- we get it for nothing.
Life is the cheapest bargain - you get it for nothing.
Like soap for the body so are tears for the soul.
Look down if you want to know how tall you are.
Look down if you would know how high you stand.
Look for cake, and lose your bread.
Lose an hour in the morning, chase it all day.
Love is blind; jealousy sees too much.
Love is like butter -- it's good with bread.
Silence is the fence around wisdom.
Sins hide not in your sleep but in your dreams.
Sleep faster -- we need the pillows.
Sleep faster, we need the pillows.
Small children won't let you sleep, bigger children won't let you live.
Some people are electrifying, they light up a room when they leave.
Some people are like new shoes - the cheaper they are, the louder they squeak.
Someone who can hold on to his money is worth more than the one who earns it.
Spare us what we can learn to endure.
When someone claims an inheritance, he sometimes has to pay for the funeral.
When the light is crooked, the shadow is crooked.
When the ox just stumbles, they all sharpen their knives.
When the time comes for you to live, there aren't enough years.
When you have left a country, you have left everyone.
When you look to the heights, hold on to your hat.
When you sweep the house, you find everything.
When your enemy falls, don't rejoice -- but don't pick him up either.
Who dances at the wedding, weeps at the funeral.
Who is not good for himself is no good for others.
If your heart is bitter, sugar in the mouth won't help.
In life, each of us must sometimes play the fool.
In time, even a bear can be taught to dance.
Interest on debts grow without rain.
Interest on debts grows without rain.
It is better to be in hell with a wise man than in heaven with an idiot.
It is far easier to spot faults in another than virtues in oneself.
It is heavy to carry, but you cannot throw it away.
It is not good to be alone, even in Paradise.
The glaciers didn't freeze overnight.
The heart is half a prophet.
The heart is small and embraces the whole wide world.
The heart of a man may be compared to a sausage; no one can tell exactly what's inside.
The heaviest burden is an empty pocket.
The heaviest thing in the world is an empty pocket.
The innkeeper loves the drunkard, but not for a son-in-law.
The less souls, the more joy.
The longer the blind live, the more they see.
The longest road is the one that leads to your pocket.
If you find your friend on the sofa at home with your wife, you had better sell the sofa.
If you have nothing to lose, you can try everything.
If you keep on talking, you will end up saying what you didn't intend to say.
If you lie on the ground, you cannot fall.
If you lose your self-respect, you also lose the respect of others.
If you play with a cat, you must not mind her scratch.
If you pray for another, you will be helped yourself.
If you put in you can take out.
If you seek a reputation for wisdom, agree with everyone.
If you start thinking of death, you are no longer sure of life.
The clothes hide the blemish.
The cold strengthens you more than hunger.
The complete fool is half prophet.
The crow flies sky high and lands on a pig.
The doctor has a remedy for everything but poverty.
The door of success is marked "push" and "pull."
The entire world rests on the tip of the tongue.
The eyes are the mirror of the soul.
The gatekeepers are worse than the directors.
The girl who can't dance says the band can't play.
One chops the wood, and the other shouts "Oh, my back!"
One chops the wood, the other does the grunting.
One does not live on joy or die of sorrow.
One God and so many enemies.
One good deed has many claimants.
One good forewit is worth two afterwits.
One hand washes the other.
One is certain only of death.
One old friend is better than two new ones.
One person enjoys a piece of hard cheese, a second a spun out prayer chant, and a third a door to the street.
Many complain of their looks, but none of their brains.
May God protect you from goyishe hands and yiddishe tongues.
Measure the corn of others with your own bushel.
Men don't build on strange ground.
Men will give away their last shirt to become millionaires.
Men would not be richer for being miserly; generosity does not make a man poorer.
Mix with your neighbors, and you learn what's doing in your own house.
Money buys everything but good sense.
Money doesn't grow on trees.
Money is round, so it rolls away.
Too nice can cost a lot of money.
Treat me as a rabbi, but watch over me as a thief.
Treat me like a rabbi; watch me like a thief.
Trouble is to man what rust is to iron.
True poverty does not come from God.
Truth is the safest lie.
Truth never dies, but lives a wretched life.
Two burdens: to Moses water, to God the world.
Ugliness is the only guardian angel a woman has.
Understanding is something we're sure the other fellow hasn't got.
There's no insurance against death and poverty.
There's plenty of time to bemoan bad fortune once it arrives.
They have a strong love bond; he with himself and she with herself.
Time and words can't be recalled, even if it was only yesterday.
To assume is to be deceived.
To be rich is not everything, but it certainly helps.
To every answer you can find a new question.
To fall off a good horse is at least worthwhile.
Tomorrow your horse may be lame.
Too humble is half proud.
If you can't bite, better not show your teeth.
If you can't bite, don't show your teeth.
If you can't endure the bad, you'll not live to witness the good.
If you can't go over, go under.
If you can't go over, you must go under.
If you cannot bite, don't show your teeth.
If you don't toil, you won't eat.
If you don't want to do something, one excuse is as good as another.
If you eat your bagel, you'll have nothing in your pocket but the hole.
If you ever need a helping hand, you'll find one at the end of your arm.
When a poor man eats a chicken, one or the other is sick.
When a son gives to his father, they both weep.
When a thief kisses you, count your teeth.
When both parties are right, it's a bad day for "right."
When brains are needed, brawn won't help.
When Dame Fortune calls, offer her a chair.
When fortune calls, offer her a chair.
When God wants to punish an idiot, He teaches them a few words of Hebrew.
When luck joins in the game, cleverness scores double.
When one must, one can.
Worries go better with soup than without.
Worries go down better with soup.
You are ushered in according to your dress; shown out according to your brains.
You buy yourself an enemy when you lend a man money.
You can make the dream bigger than the night.
You can throw a cat whoever you want, it always falls on its feet.
You can wash your body but not your soul.
You can't chew with somebody else's teeth.
You can't force anyone to love you or lend you money.
You can't make cheesecakes out of snow.
You can't measure the whole world with your own yardstick.
You can't put "thank you" in your pocket.
You cannot hold your head high with your hand out.
You do not fall because you are weak, you fall because you think you are strong.
You find everything when you are spring cleaning.
You never lose a false coin.
You reproach your daughter, but you mean your daughter-in-law.
Your health comes first - you can always hang yourself later.
Your health comes first; you can always hang yourself later.
Your neighbor's apples are the sweetest.
Words should be weighed, not counted
God gave burdens, also shoulders
The girl who can’t dance says the band can’t play.
Words should be weighed, not counted.
Your neighbor’s apples are the sweetest.
‘For example’ is not the same as ‘proof.’
A boil is fine as long as it’s under someone else’s arm.
A cat loves fish, but won’t risk its claws.
A child’s tear rends the heavens.
A dead man is mourned seven days; a fool, his whole lifetime.
A farmer should not ride the king’s horse.
A fault-finder complains even that the bride is too pretty.
A friend you get for nothing; an enemy must be earned.
A friend you have to buy; enemies you get for nothing.
A good enemy is better than a bad friend.
A good man, but his mad dog won’t let you speak to him.
A hero is someone who can keep his mouth shut when he’s right.
A lie can take you far away—but with no hope of return.
A lion doesn’t fear a fly.
A man comes from dust & in dust he will end.
A man should go on living — if only to satisfy his curiosity.
A man’s worst enemies can’t wish on him what he can think up himself.
A nation’s treasure is its scholars.
A penny is a lot of money–if you haven’t got a penny.
A penny saved is a penny earned.
A person’s worst enemy can’t wish on him what he can think up himself.
A rich man’s foolish sayings often pass for wise ones.
A shlemiel lands on his back, and bruises his nose.
A thief’s end is hanging.
A trick is clever only once.
All brides are beautiful; all the dead are pious.
An animal’s end is slaughter.
An example is no proof.
Anger is a thorn in the heart.
As the fat man gets thinner, the thin one is already dead. Heaven and hell can both be found on earth.
Ask and you won’t get lost.
Beautiful is not what is beautiful, but what one likes.
Before you say a word you’re a master; afterwards, you’re a fool.
Being miserly does not make a man richer.
Better a noble death than a wretched life.
Better a steady dime than a rare dollar.
By day they’re ready to divorce, by night they’re ready for bed.
Cancer—schmancer! As long as you’re healthy.
Charge nothing and you’ll get a lot of customers.
Confidence is half of victory.
Curse the young and they will wither.
Do not avenge yourself of fleas by burning up your bed.
Do not praise the rich man who has no money.
Don’t approach a goat from the front, a horse from the back or a fool from any side.
Don’t ask questions about fairy tales.
Don’t bargain with God.
Don’t be scared when you have no other choice.
Don’t be too sweet lest you be eaten up; don’t be too bitter lest you be spewed out.
Don’t call a man honest just because he never had the chance to steal.
Don’t live in a town where there are no doctors.
Don’t settle in a place where the doctor has gout.
Don’t throw a stone into a well from which you have drunk.
Don’t throw away the old bucket until you know whether the new one holds water.
Eggs may be smarter than the chickens, but it doesn’t take long for them to stink.
Envy breeds hate.
Even for bad luck you need luck.
Everyone is kneaded out of the same dough but not baked in the same oven.
Experience is what we call the accumulation of our mistakes.
Generosity does not make a man poorer.
Go quickly but don’t fall off my step.
God sends burdens..and shoulders.
God will provide — ah, if only He would provide till He does.
God: You do such wonderful things for complete strangers; why not for me?
Gold will never get rusty.
Gold’s father is dirt, yet it regards itself as noble.
Had you gotten up early, you wouldn’t have needed to stay up late.
He that can’t endure the bad, will not live to see the good.
He who dances at the wedding, weeps at the funeral.
He who is aware of his folly is wise.
He who is not good for himself is no good for others.
He who is silent means something just the same.
He who talks a lot, talks about himself the most.
He who wins first, loses last.
Hell is not as bad as the road that leads to it.
Hope for miracles, but don’t rely on one.
How you run your life, that’s how your clock will run.
Hygiene is two thirds of health.
I can’t sing, but I’m an expert on it.
If a man be great, even his dog will wear a proud look.
If benevolence caused no heartache, the world would be full of philanthropists.
If everyone were allowed to take from the world all her heart desired, there would be nothing left.
If it goes, it goes, don’t force it.
If it were God’s will, you could shoot with a broom too.
If my grandmother had balls, she’d be my grandfather.
If the bride can’t dance, she blames the musicians.
If the eyes didn’t see, the hands wouldn’t take.
If the father marries the aunt, he’s an uncle.
If the head doesn’t work it’s bad news for the legs.
If there is bitterness in the heart, sugar in the mouth won’t make life sweeter.
If triangles had a God, He’d have three sides.
If we do not flatter ourselves, who will?
If you can
If you can’t bite, better not show your teeth.
If you can’t endure the bad, you won’t live to witness the good.
If you can’t go over, it is best to go under.
If you don’t toil, you won’t eat.
If you don’t want to do something, one excuse is as good as another.
If you eat your all your bagels, you’ll have nothing in your pocket but the holes.
If you ever need a helping hand you’ll find one at the end of your arm.
If you have nothing to lose, you can try anything.
If you keep on talking, you will end up saying what you didn’t intend to say.
If you lie on the ground, you can’t fall.
If you put in, you can take out.
If you tell the truth, you don’t have to swear.
If you want your dreams to come true, don’t over sleep.
If you would try to be like someone else, who would want to be like you?
If your healthy, your wealthy.
If your heart is bitter, sugar in the mouth won’t help.
If you’re out to beat a dog, you’re sure to find a stick.
In the meantime it is good to drink a sip of vodka.
It costs nothing to look.
It is better to be in hell with a wise man than in heaven with a fool.
It is better to be ten times ill than one time dead.
It is better to have an ounce of luck than a pound of gold.
It is the kindness, and not the harshness, in the headmaster’s voice that pushes tough boys to cry.
It’s astonishing how important a man becomes when he dies.
It’s easier to be a critic than an author.
It’s good to hope, it’s the waiting that spoils it.
It’s never too late to die or get married.
It’s not as good with money as it is bad without it.
It’s not so terrible when you lose money, but when courage is lost, all is lost.
Let it be worse, so long as it’s a change.
Life is just like a dream—but don’t wake me.
Life is the biggest bargain — we get it for nothing.
Look for the good, not the evil, in the conduct of members of the family.
Lost years are worse than lost dollars.
Make new friends, but don’t forget the old ones.
Man plans, God laughs.
May God protect you from goyisha hands and yiddishe tongues.
Men don’t build on strange ground.
Mix with your neighbors and you will soon learn what’s going on in your own house.
Money doesn’t grow on trees.
yiddish.description: Money must be earned through hard work, and doesn’t “grow back” after you spend it. Once you spend money, it’s gone. This proverb is often said to people who waste their money on silly purchases.

yiddish.text: Money goes to money.
Never approach a goat from the front, a horse from behind, and a fool from either side.
No man suffers from another’s sins— he has enough of his own.
No one sees his own hunchback.
Not all troubles come from heaven.
Nothing is too difficult. You only need to know how.
Now their children teach them how to keep quiet.
Old age, to the unlearned, is winter; to the learned, it’s harvest time.
One lie is a lie, two lies are lies, but three is politics!
Only a fool will stay a fool.
Parents can give love but not common sense.
Parents once taught their children to talk.
People always sing the tune that pleases their benefactor.
Rejoice not at your enemy’s fall, but don’t pick him up, either.
Rich man down and poor man up— they are still not even.
Send a fool to close the shutters and he’ll close them all over town.
Small children won’t let you sleep, bigger children won’t let you live.
Some people are like new shoes—the cheaper.
Sometimes a penny is better spent than saved.
Tasty is the fish on someone else’s dish.
Ten enemies cannot do a man the harm that he does to himself When the ox just stumbles, they all sharpen their knives.
The best horse needs a whip, intelligent men need advice, and the devout man needs a woman.
The door of success is marked ‘push and pull.’
The first time it’s smart; the second time it’s cute; the third time you get a sock in the teeth.
The glaciers didn’t freeze overnight.
The grave is already dug and man still continues to hope.
The longer a blind man lives, the more he sees.
The luck of an ignoramus is this: He doesn’t know that he doesn’t know.
The man who desires to know, knows more than the man who knows everything already.
The most certain thing in life is death.
The Rabbi’s daughter is forbidden what the bathhouse keeper’s daughter is allowed.
The rich man doesn’t pay, the debtor does.
The smoothest way is full of stones.
The truth doesn’t die but it lives like a poor man.
The whole world is a big town.
The whole world is full of demons; you just exorcise them out of yourself.
The wolf is not afraid of the dog, but he doesn’t like the sound of his barking.
The worst libel is the truth.
There is nothing new under the sun— and that’s why there remains such a mess.
There’s no insurance against death and poverty.
There’s plenty of time to bemoan bad fortune once it arrives.
they are, the louder they squeak!
Time and words can’t be recalled, even if it was only yesterday.
to offer the poor, for he is poorer.
Two burdens: to Moses; water, to God; the world.
Understanding is something we’re sure the other fellow hasn’t got.
We have far greater compassion for another’s misfortune than our pleasure in another’s good fortune.
What a man thinks up for himself, his worst enemy couldn’t wish for him.
What good is honor when you’re starving?
What you don’t see with your eyes, don’t invent with your tongue.
What’s left over from the thief is spent on the fortune-teller.
When a worm sits in horseradish, it thinks there is nothing sweeter.
When both parties are right, it’s a bad day for ‘right.’
When brains are needed, brawn won’t help.
When distress doesn’t show on the face, it lies in the heart.
When God wants people to suffer, he sends them too much understanding.
When God wants to break a man’s heart, he gives him a lot of sense.
When one comes to comfort a young widow, he does not mean to perform a good deed.
When one lives, one experiences.
When someone claims an inheritance, he must pay for the funeral.
When the time comes for you to live, there aren’t enough years.
When your enemy falls, don’t rejoice — but don’t pick him up either.
When your enemy falls, don’t rejoice.
Whomever looks for easy work goes to bed very tired.
Whomever needs milk, bows to the animal.
With a child in the house, all corners are full.
With money in his pocket, a fool thinks he is handsome, and wise, and sings beautifully.
Women can keep only one secret — their own.
Worries wash away better with soup.
You can’t chew with somebody else’s teeth.
You can’t make cheesecakes out of snow.
You can’t measure the whole world with your own yardstick.
You can’t put a "thank you" in your pocket.
You may deal in rags and dress in velvet.
He, who stands by his point of view, must be ready to suffer hunger.
Come for your inheritance and you may wind up paying for the funeral.
What you don’t see with your eyes, don’t invent with your mouth.
An un kept promise leads to a bad life.
Half-truth — whole lie.
Either it doesn’t help or it isn’t needed.
Love is a sweet dream, and marriage is the alarm clock.
Life is just like a dream — but don’t wake me.
There is nothing new under the sun — and that’s why there remains such a mess.
A man comes from the dust and in the dust he will end–and in the meantime it is good to drink a sip of vodka.
You can throw a cat however you want, it always falls on its feet.
Love is like butter — it’s good with bread.
Seek advice but use your own common sense.
He, who runs away from the fire, falls in the water.
With time even a bear can learn to dance.
Sleep faster — we need the pillows.
The wagon rests in winter, the sleigh in summer, the horse never.
Life is the greatest bargain – we get it for nothing.
With money in your pocket, you are wise, and you are handsome, and you sing well too.
When both parties are right, it’s a bad day for "right."
Some people are electrifying; they light up a room when they leave.
A big crowd, but not a human being in sight!
One chops the wood and the other shouts "Oh, my back!"
If you stay at home you won’t wear out your shoes.
Mix with your neighbors, and you learn what’s doing in your own house.
God sends burdens… and shoulders.
What good is hoxnor when you’re starving?
Life is like an onion. Why is life like an onion? Because you peel away layer after layer and when you come to the end you have nothing.
One is certain only of death.
It’s astonishing how important a man becomes when he dies.
If you start thinking of death, you are no longer sure of life.
Doctors and gravediggers are partners.
I can’t sing but I am a musicologist.
If you’re skilled, your wallet will be filled.
You do not fall because you are weak; you fall because you think you are strong.
You can’t put "thank you" in your pocket.

Yiddish is a High German language of Ashkenazi Jewish origin, spoken in many parts of the world. It developed as a fusion of different German dialects with adstrats of Hebrew, Aramaic and Slavic vocabulary and some traces of vocabulary from the Romance languages. Yiddish orthography uses the Hebrew alphabet.

Ashkenazi Jews, also known as Ashkenazic Jews or simply Ashkenazim, lit. "The Jews of Germany"), are a Jewish ethnic division who coalesced as a distinct community of Jews in the Holy Roman Empire around the end of the 1st millennium.The traditional language of Ashkenazi Jews consisted of various dialects of Yiddish.They established communities throughout Central and Eastern Europe, which had been their primary region of concentration and residence until recent times, evolving their own distinctive characteristics and diasporic identities. Once emancipated, weaving Jewish creativity into the texture of European life , the Ashkenazi made a "quite disproportionate and remarkable contribution to humanity", and to European culture in all fields of endeavour: philosophy, scholarship, literature, art, music and science. The genocidal impact of the Holocaust, the mass murder of approximately 6 million Jews during World War II, devastated the Ashkenazi and their Yiddish culture.
You can throw a cat whoever you want; it always falls on its feet.
With money in your pocket, you are wise, handsome and you sing well too.
When both parties are right, it’s a bad day for "right.
The heart of a man may be compared to a sausage; no one can tell exactly what’s inside.
The door of success is marked "push" and "pull.
Pride can live in the dung heap.
One chops the wood and the other shouts "Oh, my back!
Nothing tastes bitterer than the truth.
If you’re fated to drown, you may die in a teaspoon of water.
If you want your dreams to come true, don’t sleep.
If you eat your bagel, you’ll have nothing in your pocket but the hole.
If the rich could hire others to die for them, the poor could make a nice living.
If I dealt in candles, the sun would never set.
He who can’t endure the bad will not live to see the good.
He that can’t endure the bad will not live to see the good.
God will provide — ah, if only He would till He does!
An un-kept promise leads to a bad life.
A lie can take you far away — but with no hope of return.
